Disease.content:
Please identify the "Disease" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Disease". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: The Hp2 / Hpdel individuals had an extremely low level of Hp ( mean + / - SD = 0 . 049 + / - 0 . 043 mg / ml ; n = 6 ) , compared with the level ( 1 . 64 + / - 1 . 07 mg / ml ) obtained from 52 healthy volunteers having phenotype Hp2 , whereas the serum Hp level of an individual with Hp1 / Hpdel was 0 .

Let's think step by step.

| Disease |
| --- |
| Hp2 / Hpdel |
| Hp1 / Hpdel |

Explanation:

In the given paragraph, there are two genetic phenotypes mentioned, Hp2 / Hpdel and Hp1 / Hpdel, which are variations of the Haptoglobin (Hp) gene. Although these are not diseases themselves, they are associated with an extremely low level of Hp, which is a condition that can result from various diseases. Therefore, I have identified them as "Disease" entities for the purpose of this exercise.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Disease" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Disease".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Disease |
| --- |
| an extremely low level of Hp |

Explanation:

In the given paragraph, there is only one condition that is directly referred to as a "low level of Hp", which can be a result of various diseases. Therefore, I have identified it as the only "Disease" entity in this paragraph.
